name: highly
content:
highly adverb
(ABOVE AVERAGE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
B2 very, to a large degree, or at a high level: highly paid She was offered a highly paid job in finance. a highly profitable line of products For our country to remain competitive, we need a highly-skilled, highly-educated workforce. think/speak highly of someone
C2 to admire or say admiring things about someone: He's very highly thought of within the company.
See more
More examplesFewer examplesTobacco is highly addictive.The two men are highly suspicious of one another.The hospital is unable to provide the highly specialized care needed by very sick babies.The Birmingham Royal Ballet has had a highly successful season.Nursing is a highly skilled job.
